title: Virgin Orbit expects first U.K. launch in August
summary: Virgin Orbit expects to perform its first launch from England in late August, pending award of a British launch license, a company executive said May 25.

title: UK launches consultation on Virgin Orbit launch
summary: The U.K. announced a public consultation July 22 to assess the environmental impact of the country’s first space launch, as part of the licensing process for clearing Virgin Orbit’s mission this year.

title: Virgin Orbit awaiting license for first UK launch
summary: Virgin Orbit says it is technically ready for its next LauncherOne mission, and the first orbital launch from the United Kingdom, but is still waiting on a launch license from the British government.

title: Virgin Orbit says U.K launch licensing taking longer than expected
summary: Virgin Orbit acknowledged it has taken longer than planned to get approvals for its first launch from the United Kingdom but still expects to conduct the mission before the end of the year.

title: Spaceport Cornwall receives first U.K. spaceport license
summary: An English airport has secured the first-of-its-kind spaceport license from a British regulator that brings it one step closer to hosting the country’s first orbital launch.

title: Virgin Orbit delays first U.K. launch
summary: Just days after setting a launch date for its first launch from the United Kingdom, Virgin Orbit announced Dec. 8 it was delaying that mission for weeks because of technical and regulatory issues.

title: Virgin Orbit receives license for U.K. launch
summary: British regulators have issued a launch license to Virgin Orbit for its first LauncherOne mission from the United Kingdom, now expected to take place in January.

title: Virgin Orbit preparing for first U.K. launch
summary: After technical and licensing delays, Virgin Orbit is gearing up for its first launch from the United Kingdom as soon as Jan. 9.

title: Virgin Orbit ready for first U.K. launch
summary: Virgin Orbit is set to perform the first orbital launch from the United Kingdom as soon as Jan. 9, a milestone officials hailed as the start of a new era for the country’s space industry.

title: Virgin Orbit says it is ready to make history in the United Kingdom tonight
summary: "The public cannot wait for the UK to come and join that exclusive launch club."

title: Virgin Orbit counting down to first historic satellite launch from British soil
summary: A new chapter in spaceflight history will be made when the first ever satellites to be launched into orbit from Western Europe begin their journey into space inside a rocket slung beneath a converted jumbo jet carrier aircraft that will take off from Cornwall on the southwest peninsular of England.

title: Virgin Orbit to conduct first mission from the UK with Start Me Up
summary: Virgin Orbit will carry out the first satellite launch from the United Kingdom on Monday with the first LauncherOne mission out of Spaceport Cornwall. LauncherOne will be dropped from Virgin’s Cosmic Girl carrier aircraft, with release expected off the coast of Ireland during a 10-minute window that opens at 22:16 UTC.
